author: Staff Reporter
text:
Condemning the seizure of Rs. 15 lakh from four traders who were on their way to jaggery shandy in Paramathi Velur, sugarcane farmers, jaggery manufacturers and traders blocked the road here on Saturday last.

Members of flying squad intercepted a private bus from Paramathi Velur to Pilikalpalayam and found four persons carrying cash the cash.

Sekar , Vijayakumar, Needimanickam and Vignesh, traders from Madurai were on their way to settle the money to sugarcane farmers in the shandy. However, they could not produce any documents for the cash they were carrying. Condemning the seizure, over 200 persons blocked the road for 45 minutes. Police rushed to the spot and pacified them. Later, they withdrew their protest.

The officials also seized Rs. 3.87 lakh from a lorry in Paramathi Velur. They intercepted the lorry and found the cash hidden in-between the empty egg crates. Inquiries with the driver revealed that egg was delivered in Kerala and cash was received and being taken to the owner in Namakkal. Officials seized the cash as the driver could not produce valid documents.
title: Protest against seizure of cash from traders
